How to: Use Spell Checking with a Context Menu

By default, when you enable spell checking in an editing control like <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox>, you get spell-checking choices in the context menu.
For example, when users right-click a misspelled word, they get a set of spelling suggestions or the option to **Ignore All**.

However, when you override the default context menu with your own custom context menu, this functionality is lost, and you need to write code to reenable the spell-checking feature in the context menu.
The following example shows how to enable this on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox>.
